result.execSummary:
The defendant Adam D. Collins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

AODA and follow through.
Any other counseling as required.

defendant.name: Collins, Adam D.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Adam D. Collins in court with attorney Cana G Laska.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM242 and 15CM214 @ 10:45 a.m. (Off the record briefly) Agreement stated - 15CM214 Def will plead to ct 1, cts 2 & 3 dismiss and read in, $100 plus costs, reserve right to expunge under 973.015 after 1 yr if no crimes to probable cause and all court obligations pd, recall on 12/27/16 @ 1:00 p.m. 15CM242 - Def will plead to ct 2, ct 1 dismiss and read in, withheld sentence, 1 yr probation, AODA, court costs, State asking not to reserve right to expunge on this file. Atty Laska and Def agree. Plea quest. filed and reviewed. 15CM214 ct 1 - guilty plea. 15CM252 ct 2 - guilty plea. Court grants motion to dismiss and read in 15CM214 cts 2 & 3 and 15CM242 ct 1. Constitutional rights, elements and possible penalties reviewed. Atty Laska satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CM214 ct 1 possess THC and 15CM242 ct 2 misd bail jumping. Sentencing remarks by Counsel. Statement by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court will approve agreement. 15CM214 ct 1 - $100 plus costs, DNA sample and surcharge, pmt plan, apply bond. Court reserves right to expunge after 1 yr if no crimes to probable cause and court obligations pd. Recall 12/27/16 @ 1:00 p.m. 15CM242 ct 2 - sentence withheld, 1 yr probation, AODA and follow through, any other counseling as required, court costs inc. DNA surcharge. Credit for 4 days if revoked. Court will not reserve right to expunge on this case. Postconviction rights.   If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered, without further order of the court, against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Defendant Adam D. Collins in court with attorney Jessica L Schuster.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Special appearance.  Complaint received, reviewed and waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Court will accept pleas.  Bond will continue with conditions  Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
